ovheJ1AHP2ViB6h2NoyIuw.text: Was in London over the winter holiday for a few days and heard great things about this spot. The hot dogs are amazing! Like you wouldn't think they would be but they are! Also love the atmosphere and the bubbly! Great idea for happy hour, date, hangout with friends, etc.

kGeoqYNBsYgTpBB7ue7cbg.text: I had the sloppy joe dog with added jalapeños and Rose Champagne. Simple yet delicious is my kinda style.

photos.caption: Photo of Bubbledogs - London, United Kingdom. Rose, sloppy joe dog and BLT dog.

SR5UOtr5V5GvLj1NQuE0Jw.text: This place is so awesome. Dogs are all made in house. Each time I'm in London I always have to go eat here.

photos.caption: Photo of Bubbledogs - London, United Kingdom

DHpeDq7WNoGxUhecrTTp7g.text: Let's be real. The reason why we go here is because they put champagne with hotdogs which is a fancy [read: weird] combo. While the service is good, the food isn't anything to write a review about. I tried 2 hotdogs and neither were terribly great. Fortunately, the tarter tots were amazing. Luckily there wasn't a line to get in when I arrived or I would have been mad at myself for waiting. Skip this place. There are much better places in the city to eat. If you still choose to go here skip the hotdogs and order champagne and tots. That's still just as fancy right? lol

Photo of Bubbledogs - London, United Kingdom. 4th of July + Fernando hotdogs on the bottom with champagne and tots

_kBsGJJnvDiBQAPVA9mcDw.text: Bubbledogs has been a sort of mythical place in London for the best part of the last year (2013) so it was with quite an amusement that we actually got a chance to dine there. I was looking forward into trying it out almost immediately once it was open, but then I was visiting London just for a few short days and it requires a trip to Fitzrovia and some amount of patience to actually get a table.We were told we would need to wait 2h for a table or we could immediately be sited at the bar. We were quite lucky I guess but they anyway take reservations only for the groups of six or larger (I guess because their sitting options are table with bar stools for six to eight people). So maybe our sitting arrangements were not very comfy but still it wasn't much different then the other people in the place.After you've finished browsing 100-or-so pages of their bubbles selection (it's not all champagne but it's all bubbly) you finally arrive at their dog selection. Which are quite nice: naked dog (just bun + sausage), Reubens (with 'slaw), Sloppy Joe etc. You are always left with a selection of turkey, beef or pork dog. And they are really tasty!Plus the bubbles. It is fancy and it is a nice idea and it is definitely worth exploring if you are tired off all the other options like burgers, pulled pork sandwiches and so on.

photos.caption: Photo of Bubbledogs - London, United Kingdom. Reuben
Photo of Bubbledogs - London, United Kingdom. Vilmart & Cie

xioH3SpG5ZpWHSXKEQ5o9Q.text: Just to clarify that place serves HOT DOGS and CHAMPAGNE. Surely that alone is enough to convince about 88% of the adult population of London to visit. I called in during the week with my friend Tasha, who had left me waiting for her in the cold for an hour while she dealt with some sort of real life emergency. It was actually too busy when we went, but the host said he'd drop us a text in 45 minutes when a table would be free. We went to a local pub and warmed our cockles on some vino in the meanwhile.When we went to claim our table, it became clear why we had to wait at all. Bubbledogs is TINY. Like, my bum barely fit through the door. It's also kinda dark (basically a cave. You might as well hide a horcrux in there), but moving swiftly on. We were brought menus and decided that we'd get a dog, a side each and a bottle of champagne to share. As we looked around, most people seemed to be having a dog and a glass only. Apparently it's the done thing, especially on a Monday when that combination is on special for a tenner. One measly glass doesn't interest me though, so no hard feelings.I opted for the Fernando dog, which comes with chorizo, onion and peppers and a drizzle of garlic aioli. At this point, I must have been pretty drunk already because the waitress asked if I wanted pork or beef and I thought she was talking about the chorizo. Hoho. Anyway, I cleverly kept my trap shut and got all the pork goodness. My friend got the Sloppy Joe, which was obviously drenched in chilli and cheddar. Not only were the hotdogs amazing, but our sweet potato sides were to die for as well.I believe it was John Lennon who said "Everything will be OK in the end. If it's not OK, it's not the end." Well, everything wasn't OK and this wasn't the bloody end. We wanted more pork! More booze! So when we called over the waitress and she clearly thought we wanted the bill, we demanded more hot dogs (I got the Sloppy Joe, can't remember what Tashbag got) and another bottle. BAZINGA! Bubbledogs 4 lyfe.

O6FkTlzXvyaWUlbyQBtRLw.text: 3.5 starsInstead of the traditional pubs nearby we came here. Little did I know people have waited nearly an hour to get into this 30-person capacity bar. The concept wasn't so clear to me because I couldn't read the neon sign outside. "Bubbledogs." It's not as laid back or roomy as a pub, but we were able to have a drink, a bite (mandatory) and a fairly comfortably chat.Instead of the bubbles (aka Champagne) we had beer from the small 4 choice list. These were mostly local brews, like Pressure Drop. We did get some dogs, but it took a minute to understand the concept. My buffalo (pork) dog came loaded with the classic buffalo sauce: tangy, spicy. Added was blue cheese cubes and onion. Pretty tasty and not too salty. We shared the sweet potato fries. These seem to be a new introduction to London, yet you'll see see them in every self-respecting burger and gastro pub in Los Angeles. I Washed it down with that Pressure Drop beer. Despite it being cramped, I liked this place for its vibe and for bringing champagne down from its lux podium. Perfect for after work with a couple of people. The selection of dogs is better than some, but there's still no "healthy" meat, like chicken, although there is a vegetarian dog. I hear in the rear of this place is a fine dining restaurant which requires reservations. In L.A. The hotdog craze was probably kicked off by Wurtkusche in the Arts District. It has very exotic meat dogs, but served in a regular way as the flavour is in dog, not the toppings. It also serves up beers, not bubbles.

GXYk5X4H9m9AHOY55yxcoA.text: Besides the inventive food and lovely cocktails (or bubbles, if that's your thing), the service was incredible! It was our final evening in London after spending 3 weeks touring around the English countryside and the staff gave us an amazing experience. Thank you, Bubbledogs :)

photos.caption: Photo of Bubbledogs - London, United Kingdom. Chippy!

F2NJ0lwwepmu-TkPZ12SCw.text: Champagne sélection is good and not overt priced but hell the glasses are small! Tried the Tots and devil something, it's ok but I wouldn't kill for it. Haven't tried the hot dogs but they were enticing. Staff is hipster-style pretentious and cool

photos.caption: Photo of Bubbledogs - London, United Kingdom

WKdNkAKkP1dOiBt1fm_mqw.text: It's hard to find a sit-down restaurant that will serve tater tots, let alone tots and champagne. This certainly satisfies that craving. As a vegetarian, I certainly appreciate that almost everything on the can be veggie! I got the corndog, aka "horny dog" and although it's not like the American version I know, it was great. The batter was a cross between pancakes and hush puppies. I really appreciated the wait system, too. We put down our names and went to a wine bar, and when we got a text that our table was ready, we simply texted back and asked if we could push it back an hour. We received a call back and said it wouldn't be an issue. So easy!!

photos.caption: Photo of Bubbledogs - London, United Kingdom. Horny (veggie) dog!

C8dIYmlA2g2n83vPpcQw5w.text: This place is definitely a must try in London! The hot dogs are great and the champagne choices are even better!  They have other cocktails if you're a champagne drinker as well. I got the philly hot dog which was pretty good. The atmosphere is chic rustic/cute. The tater-tots and sweet potato fries are amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Bubbledogs - London, United Kingdom. Bubbles before the dogs!
